name: Domestic Violence
short_description: Partner has left due to domestic violence and is unlikely to return

relationship.tenant_or_partner: One partner of a married couple or civil partnership
relationship.cohabitees: Or one of a cohabiting couple

departure.left_property: The partner has left the dwelling because of violence or threats of violence

court_satisfied.unlikely_to_return: Court is satisfied that the partner who left is unlikely to return

notice_period.court_proceedings: Can be started after notice period

evidence_required: Police reports of domestic violence incidents
Evidence partner has left the property

high_probability: Clear evidence partner unlikely to return
medium_probability: Partner has left and moved elsewhere

notes: Ground 14A is MANDATORY if conditions are met. Created to allow landlords to evict a perpetrator of domestic violence when the victim-partner has fled. Often used by social landlords. Requires clear evidence that violence caused departure and partner is unlikely to return.
case_law: Camden LBC v Mallett [2001] - Partner must have left due to violence
Sanctuary Housing Association v Campbell [2014] - Evidence of violence required
court_considerations: Was there violence or threats of violence?
Did the partner leave because of the violence?
Is the departed partner unlikely to return?

special_considerations.perpetrator_remains: The perpetrator/remaining tenant loses security of tenure
special_considerations.victim_protection: Ground designed to protect victims by removing perpetrators
special_considerations.social_housing: Often used by housing associations and councils
special_considerations.injunctions: Non-molestation orders can support the case
